I think I want to start with the Eiffel Tower in Paris. Do you have any insider tips or recommendations for visiting there?

Sure! Here are some tips and recommendations for visiting the Eiffel Tower in Paris:

1. Book your tickets in advance: The Eiffel Tower attracts millions of visitors every year, so it's highly recommended that you book your tickets in advance to avoid waiting in long lines. You can book your tickets online at the official Eiffel Tower website.

2. Choose the right time to visit: The best time to visit the Eiffel Tower is usually early morning or late afternoon when the crowds are thinner. Visiting during the weekdays is also a good idea if you want to avoid crowds.

3. Take the stairs: If you are physically fit, it's recommended that you take the stairs instead of the elevator to the first or second floor. This will not only save you some money, but it's also a great workout and will save you valuable time in avoiding long elevator lines.

4. Plan your visit carefully: It's a good idea to plan your visit to the Eiffel Tower carefully, taking into consideration what you want to see and do. If you want to watch the sunset over Paris, for example, plan to visit the tower in the late afternoon so you can enjoy the view.

5. Dress appropriately: The Eiffel Tower is outdoor, and the weather can be unpredictable, so it's always a good idea to bring appropriate clothing. A hat or umbrella is recommended if there's a high chance of rain. Wearing comfortable shoes is also a must since you will be walking a lot.

I hope you find these tips useful and enjoy your visit to the Eiffel Tower!
